intro: Chamaesyce jejuna, commonly known as the smallleaf sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae, which includes many species of succulent plants. The plant has small, fleshy, oval leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax, a characteristic feature of many members of its family. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
